N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 1900.4 - Housing trust funds

State Regulations
(a) Payments, grants or loans shall be used solely to pay for the actual and necessary cost
to construct, rehabilitate or convert a project. (b) No more than 50 percent of the total
amount of funds originally appropriated in a single fiscal year to the
corporation shall be allocated to projects within a single
municipality. (c) No more than one
third of the total amount of funds originally appropriated in a single fiscal
year to the corporation shall be allocated to: (1)
private developers for projects within a
city with a population of one million or more; and
(2)
private developers for projects outside
cities with a population of one million or more. (d) The term of any loan made hereunder shall
not exceed 30 years. (e) Payments, grants or loans hereunder shall not exceed a total of $55,000 per dwelling
unit. The corporation may, in its discretion, provide a payment, loan or grant
in excess of $55,000 but not in excess of $75,000. A payment grant or loan may
also be made from the High Cost Areas Demonstration Account pursuant to section
1904.2
(c) of this

Title, subject to the $75,000 limit. Notes
